name: 23-TAH-96113-03
LongText: DESCRIPTION OF FAULT: The hypochlorite generators have been neglected for over 1 year with PPMs deferred and no vendor sent for support. CONSEQUENCE / IMPACT: Units out of service MITIGATIONS AND / OR CORRECTIVE STEPS REQUIRED OR TAKEN: What actions are required or have been taken: ·   To minimize the severity of the fault? ·   Reduce the likelihood of the consequence occurring? ·   To manage or prevent the situation from deteriorating? ·   How robust and how long will the mitigation last? MANNING; MATERIAL AND SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED 1 engineer for 2 days engineer to bring basic toolkit for any immediate repairs LOCATION / ACCESS REQUIREMENTS / SCAFFOLD / ANY OTHER INFO TERMINATION DRAWING: LAYOUT DRAWING: SUGGESTED FIX: vendor to get a baseline of the condition of all units in the field in order to asses the appropriate maintenance action to be taken. The line walk <(>&<)> survey would cover the complete system from tank to injection point including: - general inspection of pipe work and tubing installations - inspection of tank - check of calibration dates for PSV/PRV <(>&<)> Gauges - check setting of PSV - check injection pressure - measure pumped volume - check shut-of valves and bleed valves - check conditions of cables - check conditions of instruments - check pulsation dampers ( pre-charging if needed ) - check function of check valves - check start/stop function Any immediate repairs can also be done on site by the attending engineer.

CONSEQUENCE / IMPACT: Units out of service MITIGATIONS AND / OR CORRECTIVE STEPS REQUIRED OR TAKEN: What actions are required or have been taken: ·   To minimize the severity of the fault? ·   Reduce the likelihood of the consequence occurring? ·   To manage or prevent the situation from deteriorating? ·   How robust and how long will the mitigation last? MANNING; MATERIAL AND SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED 1 engineer for 2 days engineer to bring basic toolkit for any immediate repairs LOCATION / ACCESS REQUIREMENTS / SCAFFOLD / ANY OTHER INFO TERMINATION DRAWING: LAYOUT DRAWING: SUGGESTED FIX: vendor to get a baseline of the condition of all units in the field in order to asses the appropriate maintenance action to be taken. The line walk <(>&<)> survey would cover the complete system from tank to injection point including: - general inspection of pipe work and tubing installations - inspection of tank - check of calibration dates for PSV/PRV <(>&<)> Gauges - check setting of PSV - check injection pressure - measure pumped volume - check shut-of valves and bleed valves - check conditions of cables - check conditions of instruments - check pulsation dampers ( pre-charging if needed ) - check function of check valves - check start/stop function Any immediate repairs can also be done on site by the attending engineer.

CONSEQUENCE / IMPACT: Units out of service MITIGATIONS AND / OR CORRECTIVE STEPS REQUIRED OR TAKEN: What actions are required or have been taken: ·   To minimize the severity of the fault? ·   Reduce the likelihood of the consequence occurring? ·   To manage or prevent the situation from deteriorating? ·   How robust and how long will the mitigation last? MANNING; MATERIAL AND SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED 1 engineer for 2 days engineer to bring basic toolkit for any immediate repairs LOCATION / ACCESS REQUIREMENTS / SCAFFOLD / ANY OTHER INFO TERMINATION DRAWING: LAYOUT DRAWING: SUGGESTED FIX: vendor to get a baseline of the condition of all units in the field in order to asses the appropriate maintenance action to be taken. The line walk <(>&<)> survey would cover the complete system from tank to injection point including: - general inspection of pipe work and tubing installations - inspection of tank - check of calibration dates for PSV/PRV <(>&<)> Gauges - check setting of PSV - check injection pressure - measure pumped volume - check shut-of valves and bleed valves - check conditions of cables - check conditions of instruments - check pulsation dampers ( pre-charging if needed ) - check function of check valves - check start/stop function Any immediate repairs can also be done on site by the attending engineer.

MANNING; MATERIAL AND SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED 1 engineer for 2 days engineer to bring basic toolkit for any immediate repairs LOCATION / ACCESS REQUIREMENTS / SCAFFOLD / ANY OTHER INFO TERMINATION DRAWING: LAYOUT DRAWING: SUGGESTED FIX: vendor to get a baseline of the condition of all units in the field in order to asses the appropriate maintenance action to be taken. CONSEQUENCE / IMPACT: Units out of service MITIGATIONS AND / OR CORRECTIVE STEPS REQUIRED OR TAKEN: What actions are required or have been taken: ·   To minimize the severity of the fault? ·   Reduce the likelihood of the consequence occurring? ·   To manage or prevent the situation from deteriorating? ·   How robust and how long will the mitigation last? MANNING; MATERIAL AND SPECIAL TOOLS REQUIRED 1 engineer for 2 days engineer to bring basic toolkit for any immediate repairs LOCATION / ACCESS REQUIREMENTS / SCAFFOLD / ANY OTHER INFO TERMINATION DRAWING: LAYOUT DRAWING: SUGGESTED FIX: vendor to get a baseline of the condition of all units in the field in order to asses the appropriate maintenance action to be taken. The line walk <(>&<)> survey would cover the complete system from tank to injection point including: - general inspection of pipe work and tubing installations - inspection of tank - check of calibration dates for PSV/PRV <(>&<)> Gauges - check setting of PSV - check injection pressure - measure pumped volume - check shut-of valves and bleed valves - check conditions of cables - check conditions of instruments - check pulsation dampers ( pre-charging if needed ) - check function of check valves - check start/stop function Any immediate repairs can also be done on site by the attending engineer.
healthWarning: ["Work order is not ready for execution"]
